title: I think mana is a serious problem right now
body:
with mana pot removed, flask removed, and having corrution pot against long sword+3hp pot is defintely not a great idea.


how are we gonna be able to lane against manaless champions such as tryn renekton mundo zed yasuo katarina shen akali vladmier shyvana lee sin and manymore if we play a champion with mana? whether if they start boot&4pot, longsword&3pot, dorans shied/blade with two pot or cloth armor& 4 pot they still going to outsustain you. so you will be forced to recall before ur enemy because u ran out of mana, your enemy will outfarm u, get more exp and maybe do some dmg on your turret. in some extreme cases when u are back into lane your enemy might already sustain themselves up and ready to stay another round to farm(ie tryn and vlad with built in healing.)

i think this is quite a issue now because in my own experience my teammate or myself with a mana champion often has a hard time against manaless champions due to them being able to stay in lane so long you can never leave lane to roam even when u are ahead and u probably cant kill them unless they make really dumb decisions because they have good sustain and u cant afford the mana to harass them.

something need to be changed now, either some buff to mana pool/regen or nerf the sustain of the manaless champions abit. otherwise mana champions will soon fall out of favour.

Mana users, even when they don't spam spells wildly, are at a massive resource disadvantage exactly because energy and manaless users CAN spam wildly. Even if you attempt to retaliate during their cooldown windows, you will stillburn a resource that recovers MUCH slower than your opponent's does, and once their cooldowns are back up they don't need to also wait for mana recovery to jump you.

Let a lane phase go long enough and the mana user will always end up low and either recalling or dying. If they can't burst the manaless user down before their mana resource dies to attrition, it's gg for the lane. And manaless champions often have equal or HIGHER burst damage to mana users, so the mana user doesn't have the power advantage needed to kill while their resources are strong enough to allow free spell use.

Just my opinion, but I really don't think champions with infinite or swiftly-recovering resources like Manaless Rage Energy and Flow should HAVE burst damage. Their long-lasting resources should give them an Over Time advantage, not a Burst advantage.

You learn to budget your mana.

Edit: kinda hard for mana based champions to fall out of favor when the MAJORITY of champions are mana based.

It just needs to hold out until your job is done. 

Most Fighters have Taken up Corrupting potion. Seems like a fine replacement for flask. And those champs seem to only have said problems in the early game. Which is what Corrupting potion is so good for. 

As for tanks, I'd argue the one's who don't build FH are most likely Juggernauts. But Juggernauts, (like Assassins) can do their Job long before the mana runs out. But most Caster Tanks should build FH. Simply put it, Your CC is your Defenses. Your enemy can't hurt you if their CCed. And a lot of those same spells apply to their offensive capabilities as well.
